item.title: Report X-2023080598
item.description:
Report X-2023080598

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found during the unload phase, wet and was placed into a lined Hazmat tote. DescribePack: The caps of the inner containers were loose and leaked causing damage to outer packaging. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed into hazmat lined tote immediately after discovery.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHEN PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO QA THE METAL PAIL WAS DENTED AND LEAKING. THE PROPER PPE ATTIRE AND TOOLS WERE USED IN SECURING THE LEAKING HAZMAT. DescribePack: THE METAL PAIL WAS DENTED AND THE TOP CLOSURE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE METAL PAIL WITH FLAMMABLE LIQUID WAS PUT INTO A HAZMAT LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2023080387
item.description:
Report E-2023080387

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced a : UN1819 Sodium Aluminate release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released impacting a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor and a 1' x 1' area of the dock floor due to a puncture. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents and neutralizer were deployed to clean the impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all waste into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080568
item.description:
Report X-2023080568

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was coming out of the trailer during the unload process when it was observed that the side and part of the bottom of the box was wet and had a strong odor. The package was then placed in a hazmat bag lined tote and taken to QA for processing DescribePack: The top of one of the bottles came loose during the shipping process DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The top was tightened down

item.title: Report X-2023080515
item.description:
Report X-2023080515

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-29
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed at horseshoe and its presence notified to QA; placed in hazmat tote. DescribePack: Package failed at cap of one container, which soiled entire side of box inside and outside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in hazmat tote, assessed for ISF, DPR, and HESS, and placed in hazmat cage vent to stop any possible fumes.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded which was then noticed as soiled. The package was placed in the Hazmat cage in a red hazardous tote and hazardous tote bag. DescribePack: The damage to the bottle indicates it was dropped because the base of the neck has some dented plastic. DurationRel: 38 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bag and tote in the hazmat cage to be inspected. package was placed in upright position.

item.title: Report X-2023080288

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I had went to the hut and randomly, I saw a hazmat that was destroyed and needed to be processed right away. DescribePack: 2 bottles out of 4 had a missing cap which caused the liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I had placed a hazmat bag into the yellow drum and placed it into the hazmat cage awaiting the disposition.
